page.title: 10ST MAWGAN CRICKET CLUB
page.content: The cricket club was restarted in 1947 by Jack Trevenna. The club play on the village playing field, and have built their own pavillion. Most matches are played in a friendly atmosphere, and involve much of the community- cricket teas, spectating, fund raising, annual dinner. Matches attract village spectators, because of the lovely setting and smashing teas. St Mawgan C.C. play in 2 leagues and travel up to 40 miles for away matches. At the end of the year cups are awarded for captains cup, clubmans cup, best bowler, best fielder and best bats man. You have to be born or live in the parish to qualify to play, and practices are held every Wednesday and Friday. Paul Lobb in a recent match hit 205 to establish a new record score for the club.
